explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition. The free acid cannot be classified due to lack of data.

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition. The free acid cannot be classified due to lack of data.

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition. The free acid cannot be classified due to lack of data.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition. The free acid cannot be classified due to lack of data.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition. The free acid cannot be classified due to lack of data.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition. The free acid cannot be classified due to lack of data.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 706mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat dermal study reported the LD50 value of >628mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 1.98mg/L (4 hours) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of destruction of skin tissues observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (24 hour application) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Due to the fact that rabbit skin corrosivity potential is classified as Category 1C.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1979)), in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells and in vivo unscheduled DNA synthesis tests on rat stem cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2002)), though in vitro chromosome aberration tests showed positive (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in carcinogenicity studies in rats and mice (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993, 1995, 1996)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "reduced locomotor activity," "salivation," "prone position," and "tonic convulsions" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: In the available animal studies, "increased liver weight and centrilobular hepatocellular hypertrophy" were found. These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours EbC50=0.062mg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2005).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=1.15(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 6%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
